comments.body: If the only reason you're restricting Windows is a missing dependency, you can still keep it [noarch](https://conda-forge.org/docs/maintainer/knowledge_base.html#noarch-python). During installation, the solver will just inform the user of the missing dependency.

Thanks for the tip, 

I was getting some red crosses in the azure pipeline check for windows, so I took a look at the meta.yaml for MOAB which is the main dependency and copied the windows skipping from there.

https://github.com/conda-forge/moab-feedstock/blob/a6cd8ff2cf7835a4a4462d300f8e3d4249fb301a/recipe/meta.yaml#L51

But I can return it to not skip windows if that is the recommended solution.

MOAB cannot be noarch because they don't fulfil multiple other conditions (compiler, different tests, etc.) so there, a restriction has to be put in place because conda-forge builds the package for each platform and version which would fail on windows.

But I just saw that you're using `scrips` for the CLI and not `console_scripts entry_points` so the package cannot be noarch, disregard my comment. :)

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +13,17 @@build:
  number: 0
  skip: true  # [win]
  script: "{{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv"
